00016 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00017  * File:    atom.h
00018  * Purpose: header file for atom API

00026 /* avoid re-inclusion */
00027 #ifndef __ATOM_H
00028 #define __ATOM_H
00029 
00030 #include "H4api_adpt.h"
00031 
00032 /* Atom Features control */
00033 /* Define the following macro for fast hash calculations (but limited hash sizes) */
00034 #define HASH_SIZE_POWER_2
00035 
00036 /* Define the following macro for atom caching over all the atoms */
00037 #define ATOMS_ARE_CACHED
00038 
00039 /* Define the following macro for "inline" atom lookups from the cache */
00040 #ifdef ATOMS_ARE_CACHED     /* required for this to work */
00041 #define ATOMS_CACHE_INLINE
00042 #endif /* ATOMS_ARE_CACHED */
00043 
00044 #ifdef ATOMS_CACHE_INLINE
00045 /* Do swap using XOR operator. Ugly but fast... -QAK */
00046 #define HAIswap_cache(i,j) \
00047                 atom_id_cache[i]^=atom_id_cache[j], \
00048                 atom_obj_cache[i]=(void *)((hdf_pint_t)atom_obj_cache[j]^(hdf_pint_t)atom_obj_cache[i]), \
00049                 atom_id_cache[j]^=atom_id_cache[i], \
00050                 atom_obj_cache[j]=(void *)((hdf_pint_t)atom_obj_cache[i]^(hdf_pint_t)atom_obj_cache[j]), \
00051                 atom_id_cache[i]^=atom_id_cache[j], \
00052                 atom_obj_cache[i]=(void *)((hdf_pint_t)atom_obj_cache[i]^(hdf_pint_t)atom_obj_cache[j])
00053 
00054 /* Note! This is hardwired to the atom cache value being 4 */
00055 #define HAatom_object(atm) \
00056     (atom_id_cache[0]==atm ? atom_obj_cache[0] : \
00057       atom_id_cache[1]==atm ? (HAIswap_cache(0,1),atom_obj_cache[0]) : \
00058        atom_id_cache[2]==atm ? (HAIswap_cache(1,2),atom_obj_cache[1]) : \
00059         atom_id_cache[3]==atm ? (HAIswap_cache(2,3),atom_obj_cache[2]) : \
00060          HAPatom_object(atm))
00061 #endif /* ATOMS_CACHE_INLINE */
00062 
00063 #include "hdf.h"
00064 
00065 /* Group values allowed */
00066 typedef enum {BADGROUP=(-1),    /* Invalid Group */
00067 DDGROUP=0,                  /* Group ID for DD objects */
00068 AIDGROUP=1,                 /* Group ID for access ID objects */
00069 FIDGROUP=2,                 /* Group ID for file ID objects */
00070 VGIDGROUP=3,                /* Group ID for Vgroup ID objects */
00071 VSIDGROUP=4,                /* Group ID for Vdata ID objects */
00072 GRIDGROUP=5,                /* Group ID for GR ID objects */
00073 RIIDGROUP=6,                /* Group ID for RI ID objects */
00074 BITIDGROUP=7,               /* Group ID for Bitfile ID objects */
00075 ANIDGROUP=8,                /* Group ID for Annotation ID objects */
00076 MAXGROUP                    /* Highest group in group_t (Invalid as true group) */
00077 } group_t;
00078 
00079 /* Type of atoms to return to users */
00080 typedef int32 atom_t;
00081 
00082 /* Type of the function to compare objects & keys */
00083 typedef intn (*HAsearch_func_t)(const void * obj, const void * key);
00084 
00085 #if defined ATOM_MASTER | defined ATOM_TESTER
00086 
00087 /* # of bits to use for Group ID in each atom (change if MAXGROUP>16) */
00088 #define GROUP_BITS  4
00089 #define GROUP_MASK  0x0F
00090 
00091 /* # of bits to use for the Atom index in each atom (change if MAXGROUP>16) */
00092 #define ATOM_BITS   28
00093 #define ATOM_MASK   0x0FFFFFFF
00094 
00095 #ifdef ATOMS_ARE_CACHED
00096 /* # of previous atoms cached, change inline caching macros (HAatom_object & HAIswap_cache) if this changes */
00097 #define ATOM_CACHE_SIZE 4
00098 #endif /* ATOMS_ARE_CACHED */
00099 
00100 /* Map an atom to a Group number */
00101 #define ATOM_TO_GROUP(a)    ((group_t)((((atom_t)(a))>>((sizeof(atom_t)*8)-GROUP_BITS))&GROUP_MASK))
00102 
00103 #ifdef HASH_SIZE_POWER_2
00104 /* Map an atom to a hash location (assumes s is a power of 2 and smaller than the ATOM_MASK constant) */
00105 #define ATOM_TO_LOC(a,s)    ((atom_t)(a)&((s)-1))
00106 #else /* HASH_SIZE_POWER_2 */
00107 /* Map an atom to a hash location */
00108 #define ATOM_TO_LOC(a,s)    (((atom_t)(a)&ATOM_MASK)%(s))
00109 #endif /* HASH_SIZE_POWER_2 */
00110 
00111 /* Combine a Group number and an atom index into an atom */
00112 #define MAKE_ATOM(g,i)      ((((atom_t)(g)&GROUP_MASK)<<((sizeof(atom_t)*8)-GROUP_BITS))|((atom_t)(i)&ATOM_MASK))
00113 
00114 /* Atom information structure used */
00115 typedef struct atom_info_struct_tag {
00116     atom_t id;              /* atom ID for this info */
00117     VOIDP *obj_ptr;         /* pointer associated with the atom */
00118     struct atom_info_struct_tag *next;   /* link to next atom (in case of hash-clash) */
00119   }atom_info_t;
00120 
00121 /* Atom group structure used */
00122 typedef struct atom_group_struct_tag {
00123     uintn count;            /* # of times this group has been initialized */
00124     intn hash_size;         /* size of the hash table to store the atoms in */
00125     uintn atoms;            /* current number of atoms held */
00126     uintn nextid;           /* atom ID to use for the next atom */
00127     atom_info_t **atom_list;/* pointer to an array of ptrs to atoms */
00128   }atom_group_t;
00129 
00130 /* Define this in only one place */
00131 #ifdef ATOM_MASTER
00132 
00133 /* Array of pointers to atomic groups */
00134 static atom_group_t *atom_group_list[MAXGROUP]={NULL};
00135 
00136 /* Pointer to the atom node free list */
00137 static atom_info_t *atom_free_list=NULL;
00138 
00139 #ifdef ATOMS_ARE_CACHED
00140 /* Array of pointers to atomic groups */
00141 #ifdef OLD_WAY
00142 static atom_t atom_id_cache[ATOM_CACHE_SIZE]={-1,-1,-1,-1};
00143 static VOIDP atom_obj_cache[ATOM_CACHE_SIZE]={NULL};
00144 #else /* OLD_WAY */
00145 HDFPUBLIC atom_t atom_id_cache[ATOM_CACHE_SIZE]={-1,-1,-1,-1};
00146 HDFPUBLIC VOIDP atom_obj_cache[ATOM_CACHE_SIZE]={NULL};
00147 #endif /* OLD_WAY */
00148 #endif /* ATOMS_ARE_CACHED */
00149 #endif /* ATOM_MASTER */
00150 
00151 /* Useful routines for generally private use */
00152 
00153 #endif /* ATOM_MASTER | ATOM_TESTER */
00154 
00155 #ifndef ATOM_MASTER
00156 HDFLIBAPI atom_t atom_id_cache[];
00157 HDFLIBAPI VOIDP atom_obj_cache[];
00158 #endif /* ATOM_MASTER */

00160 #if defined c_plusplus || defined __cplusplus
00161 extern      "C"
00162 {
00163 #endif                          /* c_plusplus || __cplusplus */
00164 
00165 /******************************************************************************
00166  NAME
00167      HAinit_group - Initialize an atomic group
00168 
00169  DESCRIPTION
00170     Creates an atomic group to store atoms in.  If the group has already been
00171     initialized, this routine just increments the count of # of initializations
00172     and returns without trying to change the size of the hash table.
00173 
00174  RETURNS
00175     Returns SUCCEED if successful and FAIL otherwise
00176 
00177 *******************************************************************************/
00178 HDFLIBAPI intn HAinit_group(group_t grp,      /* IN: Group to initialize */
00179     intn hash_size                  /* IN: Minimum hash table size to use for group */
00180 );
00181 
00182 /******************************************************************************
00183  NAME
00184      HAdestroy_group - Destroy an atomic group
00185 
00186  DESCRIPTION
00187     Destroys an atomic group which atoms are stored in.  If the group still
00188     has atoms which are registered, this routine fails.  If there have been
00189     multiple initializations of the group, this routine just decrements the
00190     count of initializations and does not check the atoms out-standing.
00191 
00192  RETURNS
00193     Returns SUCCEED if successful and FAIL otherwise
00194 
00195 *******************************************************************************/
00196 HDFLIBAPI intn HAdestroy_group(group_t grp       /* IN: Group to destroy */
00197 );
00198 
00199 /******************************************************************************
00200  NAME
00201      HAregister_atom - Register an object in a group and get an atom for it.
00202 
00203  DESCRIPTION
00204     Registers an object in a group and returns an atom for it.  This routine
00205     does _not_ check for unique-ness of the objects, if you register an object
00206     twice, you will get two different atoms for it.  This routine does make
00207     certain that each atom in a group is unique.  Atoms are created by getting
00208     a unique number for the group the atom is in and incorporating the group
00209     into the atom which is returned to the user.
00210 
00211  RETURNS
00212     Returns atom if successful and FAIL otherwise
00213 
00214 *******************************************************************************/
00215 HDFLIBAPI atom_t HAregister_atom(group_t grp,     /* IN: Group to register the object in */
00216     VOIDP object                        /* IN: Object to attach to atom */
00217 );
00218 
00219 /******************************************************************************
00220  NAME
00221      HAatom_object - Returns to the object ptr for the atom 
00222 
00223  DESCRIPTION
00224     Retrieves the object ptr which is associated with the atom.
00225 
00226  RETURNS
00227     Returns object ptr if successful and NULL otherwise
00228 
00229 *******************************************************************************/
00230 #ifdef ATOMS_CACHE_INLINE
00231 HDFLIBAPI VOIDP HAPatom_object(atom_t atm   /* IN: Atom to retrieve object for */
00232 );
00233 #else /* ATOMS_CACHE_INLINE */
00234 HDFLIBAPI VOIDP HAatom_object(atom_t atm   /* IN: Atom to retrieve object for */
00235 );
00236 #endif /* ATOMS_CACHE_INLINE */
00237 
00238 /******************************************************************************
00239  NAME
00240      HAatom_group - Returns to the group for the atom 
00241 
00242  DESCRIPTION
00243     Retrieves the group which is associated with the atom.
00244 
00245  RETURNS
00246     Returns group if successful and FAIL otherwise
00247 
00248 *******************************************************************************/
00249 HDFLIBAPI group_t HAatom_group(atom_t atm   /* IN: Atom to retrieve group for */
00250 );
00251 
00252 /******************************************************************************
00253  NAME
00254      HAremove_atom - Removes an atom from a group
00255 
00256  DESCRIPTION
00257     Removes an atom from a group.
00258 
00259  RETURNS
00260     Returns atom's object if successful and FAIL otherwise
00261 
00262 *******************************************************************************/
00263 HDFLIBAPI VOIDP HAremove_atom(atom_t atm   /* IN: Atom to remove */
00264 );
00265 
00266 /******************************************************************************
00267  NAME
00268      HAsearch_atom - Search for an object in a group and get it's pointer.
00269 
00270  DESCRIPTION
00271     Searchs for an object in a group and returns the pointer to it.
00272     This routine calls the function pointer passed in for each object in the
00273     group until it finds a match.  Currently there is no way to resume a
00274     search.
00275 
00276  RETURNS
00277     Returns pointer an atom's object if successful and NULL otherwise
00278 
00279 *******************************************************************************/
00280 HDFLIBAPI VOIDP HAsearch_atom(group_t grp,        /* IN: Group to search for the object in */
00281     HAsearch_func_t func,               /* IN: Ptr to the comparison function */
00282     const void * key                     /* IN: pointer to key to compare against */
00283 );
00284 
00285 /******************************************************************************
00286  NAME
00287      HAshutdown - Terminate various static buffers.
00288 
00289  DESCRIPTION
00290     Free various buffers allocated in the HA routines.
00291 
00292  RETURNS
00293     Returns SUCCEED/FAIL
00294 
00295 *******************************************************************************/
00296 HDFLIBAPI intn HAshutdown(void);
00297 
00298 #if defined c_plusplus || defined __cplusplus
00299 }
00300 #endif                          /* c_plusplus || __cplusplus */
00301 
00302 #endif /* __ATOM_H */
